Audio Description: This World War Two promotes nutritional lunches in America’s schools. The background of the poster is dominated by an illustration of a young boy with a baseball. He is wearing a brown cap, a yellow shirt and brown pants. He is holding a white baseball in one hand in his right hand and a brown baseball glove covers his left hand. His right leg is bent at the knee as if he is in the motion of pitching the ball. Behind him a young girl is squatting, as she is ready to field a ball hit to her on a green field. She has dark hair with two pigtails. She is wearing a yellow dress and a brown baseball glove on her left hand. She is wearing dark shoes and yellow socks. To the right and behind the young girl in the distance is a red schoolhouse with an American flag to its left. The sky behind the scene is blue. In the forefront of the poster is a photograph of a grade school boy eating lunch. With his left hand, the boy is putting a forkful of food into his mouth. In his right hand, he is holding either an orange of an apple. There is a spoon on the full plate of food in front of the boy, and a full glass of white milk to his left. Over the yellow shirt of the boy in the act of throwing the baseball printed in capital letters are the words: “Every child needs a good school lunch.” At the bottom of the poster are the words: “The War Food Administration will help your community state a school lunch program.”
Creator: United States. War Food Administration. Distribution Office
